message:
Use of LINE:

Draws straight line segments accurately.

Practical Tip:
- Enable OSNAP for precision.

Steps:
1. Type LINE
2. Pick start point
3. Pick end point
4. Press Enter

Use of POLYLINE:

Creates connected line segments as a single object.

Practical Tip:
- Use width option for thick lines.

Steps:
1. Type POLYLINE
2. Select points
3. Press Enter

Use of CIRCLE:

Creates circles using multiple methods.

Practical Tip:
- Center-radius is fastest.

Steps:
1. Type CIRCLE
2. Pick center
3. Enter radius

Use of ARC:

Draws curved segments.

Practical Tip:
- Use start-center-end for control.

Steps:
1. Type ARC
2. Select points

Use of RECTANGLE:

Creates rectangular shapes quickly.

Practical Tip:
- Use chamfer or fillet options.

Steps:
1. Type RECTANGLE
2. Pick two corners

Use of OFFSET:

Creates parallel copies of objects.

Practical Tip:
- Common for walls.

Steps:
1. Type OFFSET
2. Enter distance
3. Select object

Use of TRIM:

Removes unwanted object portions.

Practical Tip:
- Press Enter to select all edges.

Steps:
1. Type TRIM
2. Trim objects

Use of EXTEND:

Extends objects to boundaries.

Practical Tip:
- Works opposite of TRIM.

Steps:
1. Type EXTEND
2. Select boundaries

Use of MOVE:

Moves objects accurately.

Practical Tip:
- Use base point snap.

Steps:
1. Type MOVE
2. Select object

Use of COPY:

Creates duplicates of objects.

Practical Tip:
- Use multiple copy.

Steps:
1. Type COPY
2. Select objects

Use of ROTATE:

Rotates objects around a base point.

Practical Tip:
- Use reference option.

Steps:
1. Type ROTATE
2. Select base point

Use of SCALE:

Resizes objects proportionally.

Practical Tip:
- Avoid scaling dimensions.

Steps:
1. Type SCALE
2. Enter scale factor

Use of MIRROR:

Creates symmetrical copies.

Practical Tip:
- Decide delete source or not.

Steps:
1. Type MIRROR
2. Select mirror line

Use of FILLET:

Rounds object corners.

Practical Tip:
- Set radius first.

Steps:
1. Type FILLET
2. Set radius

Use of CHAMFER:

Creates beveled edges.

Practical Tip:
- Used for sharp corners.

Steps:
1. Type CHAMFER
2. Set distances

Use of ARRAY:

Creates repeated patterns.

Practical Tip:
- Use polar for circular layouts.

Steps:
1. Type ARRAY
2. Choose array type

Use of HATCH:

Fills closed areas with patterns.

Practical Tip:
- Check boundary closure.

Steps:
1. Type HATCH
2. Pick area

Use of LAYER:

Manages drawing organization.

Practical Tip:
- Use naming standards.

Steps:
1. Type LAYER
2. Create layers

Use of DIMSTYLE:

Controls dimension appearance.

Practical Tip:
- Create scale-specific styles.

Steps:
1. Type DIMSTYLE
2. Modify style

Use of DIMLFAC:

Controls dimension scaling factor.

Practical Tip:
- Useful for non-1:1 drawings.

Steps:
1. Type DIMLFAC
2. Enter factor

Use of TEXT:

Adds single-line text.

Practical Tip:
- Use for small labels.

Steps:
1. Type TEXT
2. Enter text

Use of MTEXT:

Adds multi-line formatted text.

Practical Tip:
- Use for notes.

Steps:
1. Type MTEXT
2. Enter content

Use of ZOOM:

Controls drawing view.

Practical Tip:
- Use ZOOM EXTENTS often.

Steps:
1. Type ZOOM
2. Choose option

Use of PAN:

Moves view without changing scale.

Practical Tip:
- Hold mouse wheel.

Steps:
1. Type PAN
2. Drag view

Use of REGEN:

Refreshes drawing display.

Practical Tip:
- Use if drawing glitches.

Steps:
1. Type REGEN

Use of BLOCK:

Creates reusable objects.

Practical Tip:
- Name blocks logically.

Steps:
1. Type BLOCK
2. Select objects

Use of WBLOCK:

Exports blocks as files.

Practical Tip:
- Useful for libraries.

Steps:
1. Type WBLOCK
2. Save file

Use of INSERT:

Inserts blocks into drawings.

Practical Tip:
- Control scale on insert.

Steps:
1. Type INSERT
2. Choose block

Use of EXPLODE:

Breaks objects into components.

Practical Tip:
- Avoid exploding dimensions.

Steps:
1. Type EXPLODE
2. Select object

Use of PURGE:

Removes unused items.

Practical Tip:
- Clean files regularly.

Steps:
1. Type PURGE
2. Purge all

Use of OVERKILL:

Removes duplicate objects.

Practical Tip:
- Improves performance.

Steps:
1. Type OVERKILL
2. Select objects

Use of MATCHPROP:

Copies object properties.

Practical Tip:
- Speeds formatting.

Steps:
1. Type MATCHPROP
2. Select source

Use of STRETCH:

Modifies object shapes.

Practical Tip:
- Use crossing window.

Steps:
1. Type STRETCH
2. Select points

Use of ALIGN:

Aligns objects precisely.

Practical Tip:
- Can scale during align.

Steps:
1. Type ALIGN
2. Pick reference points

Use of BREAK:

Breaks objects at points.

Practical Tip:
- Useful for gaps.

Steps:
1. Type BREAK
2. Select points

Use of JOIN:

Joins multiple objects.

Practical Tip:
- Works with polylines.

Steps:
1. Type JOIN
2. Select objects

Use of PROPERTIES:

Edits object properties.

Practical Tip:
- Shortcut: Ctrl+1.

Steps:
1. Select object
2. Press Ctrl+1

Use of UCS:

Controls coordinate system.

Practical Tip:
- Essential for 3D work.

Steps:
1. Type UCS
2. Set orientation

Use of UNITS:

Controls drawing units.

Practical Tip:
- Set before drawing.

Steps:
1. Type UNITS
2. Choose format

Use of LIMITS:

Sets drawing boundaries.

Practical Tip:
- Useful for layouts.

Steps:
1. Type LIMITS
2. Define area

Use of ISOLATE:

Isolates selected objects.

Practical Tip:
- Helps focus work.

Steps:
1. Select object
2. Isolate

Use of XREF:

Attaches external drawings.

Practical Tip:
- Keep file sizes small.

Steps:
1. Type XREF
2. Attach file

Use of ATTDEF:

Defines block attributes.

Practical Tip:
- Useful for data tags.

Steps:
1. Type ATTDEF
2. Define fields

Use of ATTEDIT:

Edits block attributes.

Practical Tip:
- Double-click block.

Steps:
1. Type ATTEDIT

Use of LAYISO:

Isolates layers.

Practical Tip:
- Focus on one layer.

Steps:
1. Type LAYISO

Use of LAYFRZ:

Freezes layers.

Practical Tip:
- Improves performance.

Steps:
1. Type LAYFRZ

Use of PLOT:

Prints drawings.

Practical Tip:
- Check preview first.

Steps:
1. Type PLOT

Use of PAGESETUP:

Controls plot settings.

Practical Tip:
- Save templates.

Steps:
1. Type PAGESETUP

Use of LAYOUT:

Manages paper space.

Practical Tip:
- Use multiple layouts.

Steps:
1. Switch to layout

Use of VIEWPORT:

Creates paper space views.

Practical Tip:
- Lock scale.

Steps:
1. Type MVIEW

Use of MEASURE:

Places objects at intervals.

Practical Tip:
- Useful for symbols.

Steps:
1. Type MEASURE

Use of DIVIDE:

Divides objects equally.

Practical Tip:
- Uses points.

Steps:
1. Type DIVIDE

Use of DIST:

Measures distance.

Practical Tip:
- Quick measurement tool.

Steps:
1. Type DIST

Use of AREA:

Calculates area.

Practical Tip:
- Useful for BOQs.

Steps:
1. Type AREA

Use of REVCLOUD:

Creates revision clouds.

Practical Tip:
- Highlight changes.

Steps:
1. Type REVCLOUD

Use of MULTILEADER:

Creates leader annotations.

Practical Tip:
- Use for notes.

Steps:
1. Type MLEADER

Use of FIELD:

Inserts dynamic text.

Practical Tip:
- Auto-updating values.

Steps:
1. Type FIELD

Use of GROUP:

Groups objects temporarily.

Practical Tip:
- Non-destructive.

Steps:
1. Type GROUP

Use of VISUALSTYLES:

Controls 3D display modes.

Practical Tip:
- Use shaded view.

Steps:
1. Type VISUALSTYLES

Use of 3DORBIT:

Rotates 3D view.

Practical Tip:
- Mouse-based navigation.

Steps:
1. Type 3DORBIT
